author: Deleted User
content: Hey guys, quick question. When discussing ETH/Ether the currency in an article or story or whatnot what is the correct term to use? Should I use ETH or Ether? What is the policy you guys adhere to?

author: Deleted User
content: (Putting in education as this is in relation to a book on Ethereum).

author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: I believe the terminology is "Ether is the currency, ETH is the ticker symbol". (I may be wrong here).

author: randomishwalk
content: Ether is the token which is a currency, asset, and a utility-based commodity. ETH is the ticker. Ethereum is the technology platform

author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: For Bitcoin, it's both the currency and the protocol I suppose.

author: randomishwalk
content: Ethereum is more of a way of life tbh

author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: All ways of life are protocols ðŸ™‚

author: Deleted User
content: Thanks guys! What I am trying to find out is should I use the currency (Ether) or ticker symbol (ETH)? They both refer to the same thing in different ways.

author: Deleted User
content: From the ethereum.org Discord it seems more like ETH is more commonly used. Would that chime with people? What would you expect to see used in a book when discussing Ether/ETH?
